reviews.review_text: This game is a lot like defense grid, defense grid is a good game, therefore this is a good game. They just made it a bit more difficult than defense grid. Don't give the game a bad review just because you're bad at it.
Outstanding tower defense game. Quite challenging compared to other games in this genre

Being tasked to create a game that is the exact same as another game must be an unjolly life. Many EA employees are subject to such fates, and as Defense Technica showcases, Devolver Digital are no strangers to the concept.  If you want 'a harder Defense Grid', this might not be the worst choice.

If you blantly had to copy Defense Grid why not the superior UI as well. The interaction is clunky at best. This thing just plays like a chore. It's quite unbelieveable how one could screw up such a simple game with that much of potential.
A simple tower defence game. It seems to be a blatant copy of Defence Grid: Awakening, but without many of it's good points. Do not buy this if you like tower defence, buy Defence Grid instead.
Very meh, stick to Defense Grid: The Awakening.

Almost cool... but sadly, no. I have attempted 3 times to write a review that didn't sound like me just ranting about the seemingly random level design with dumb pre-determined placements that you can't move or control, the silliness of the AI that has creeps ignoring clear paths to go through barriers for no reason that I can discern, or the crazy difficulty ramp that has you crushing hordes of weak enemies until suddenly a wave appears that is so strong all of your defenses together manage to almost deplete the shield on a single creep. I can't seem to keep myself from ranting, see? It's fun for a while, but around level 10 it's just blah, more of the same, and not worth the frustration of spending 20 minutes carefully pruning all the possible paths down to a manageable few, only to have a sudden wave of ridiculously overpowered creeps saunter in and kill you without any possibility of winning. Worth it if you get it for really cheap, but only as a temporary diversion.   Hope the second one is better, especially for the price they're asking for it.

It just doesn't have a hook. While 'Technica' is in the title, there's not a whole lot of 'technical' to the game. I can appreciate lack of MM (some TD games are designed this way), but it's usually supplemented with the option to do so or having MM applied during a paused wave - this has neither.  It's a very basic TD game, with a standard rock-beats-paper-beats(etc) format.  And while I understand there are always similarities between games, if you're going to LOOK like Defense Grid, don't have 'Defense' in your title. Ridiculous.  Play DG2 or Gemcraft 2: Chasing Shadows if you want modern TD. This ain't it.
Unoriginal, even for a TD, a very bad UI and control scheme and an intrusive unskipable tutorial make this game not worth your while or money.
